¶ And he said, \wj  A certain man had two sons:\wj*

\wj  And the younger of them said to \+add his\+add* father,
Father, give me the portion of goods that falleth \+add to me\+add*.
And he divided unto them \+add his\+add* living. \wj*

\wj  And not many days after the younger son gathered all
together, and took his journey into a far country, and there wasted
his substance with riotous living.\wj*

\wj  And when he had spent all, there arose a mighty famine
in that land; and he began to be in want.\wj*

\wj  And he went and joined himself to a citizen of that country;
and he sent him into his fields to feed swine.\wj*

\wj  And he would fain have filled his belly with the husks
that the swine did eat: and no man gave unto him.\wj*

\wj  And when he came to himself, he said, How many hired
servants of my father’s have bread enough and to spare, and I perish
with hunger!\wj*

\wj  I will arise and go to my father, and will say unto him,
Father, I have sinned against heaven, and before thee,\wj*

\wj  And am no more worthy to be called thy son: make me as
one of thy hired servants.\wj*

\wj  And he arose, and came to his father. But when he was
yet a great way off, his father saw him, and had compassion, and
ran, and fell on his neck, and kissed him.\wj*

\wj  And the son said unto him, Father, I have sinned against
heaven, and in thy sight, and am no more worthy to be called thy
son.\wj*

\wj  But the father said to his servants, Bring forth the
best robe, and put \+add it\+add* on him; and put a ring on his hand,
and shoes on \+add his\+add* feet:\wj*

\wj  And bring hither the fatted calf, and kill \+add it\+add*;
and let us eat, and be merry:\wj*

\wj  For this my son was dead, and is alive again; he was
lost, and is found. And they began to be merry.\wj*

\wj  Now his elder son was in the field: and as he came and drew
nigh to the house, he heard musick and dancing.\wj*

\wj  And he called one of the servants, and asked what these
things meant.\wj*

\wj  And he said unto him, Thy brother is come; and thy father
hath killed the fatted calf, because he hath received him safe and
sound.\wj*

\wj  And he was angry, and would not go in: therefore came
his father out, and intreated him.\wj*

\wj  And he answering said to \+add his\+add* father, Lo,
these many years do I serve thee, neither transgressed I at any time
thy commandment: and yet thou never gavest me a kid, that I might make
merry with my friends:\wj*

\wj  But as soon as this thy son was come, which hath devoured
thy living with harlots, thou hast killed for him the fatted calf.\wj*

\wj  And he said unto him, Son, thou art ever with me, and
all that I have is thine.\wj*

\wj  It was meet that we should make merry, and be glad: for
this thy brother was dead, and is alive again; and was lost, and
is found.\wj*

And he said also unto his disciples, \wj  There was a certain
rich man, which had a steward; and the same was accused unto him
that he had wasted his goods.\wj*

\wj  And he called him, and said unto him, How is it that I
hear this of thee? give an account of thy stewardship; for thou mayest
be no longer steward.\wj*

\wj  Then the steward said within himself, What shall I do?
for my lord taketh away from me the stewardship: I cannot dig; to
beg I am ashamed.\wj*

\wj  I am resolved what to do, that, when I am put out of the
stewardship, they may receive me into their houses.\wj*

\wj  So he called every one of his lord’s debtors \+add unto
him\+add*, and said unto the first, How much owest thou unto my lord?\wj*

\wj  And he said, An hundred measures of oil. And he said unto
him, Take thy bill, and sit down quickly, and write fifty.\wj*

\wj  Then said he to another, And how much owest thou? And
he said, An hundred measures of wheat. And he said unto him, Take
thy bill, and write fourscore.\wj*

\wj  And the lord commended the unjust steward, because he had
done wisely: for the children of this world are in their generation
wiser than the children of light.\wj*

\wj  And I say unto you, Make to yourselves friends of the
mammon of unrighteousness; that, when ye fail, they may receive you
into everlasting habitations.\wj*

\wj  He that is faithful in that which is least is faithful
also in much: and he that is unjust in the least is unjust also in
much.\wj*

\wj  If therefore ye have not been faithful in the unrighteous
mammon, who will commit to your trust the true \+add riches\+add*?\wj*

\wj  And if ye have not been faithful in that which is another
man’s, who shall give you that which is your own?\wj*

\wj ¶ No servant can serve two masters: for either he will
hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to the one,
and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon.\wj*

And the Pharisees also, who were covetous, heard all these
things: and they derided him.

And he said unto them, \wj  Ye are they which justify yourselves
before men; but God knoweth your hearts: for that which is highly
esteemed among men is abomination in the sight of God.\wj*

\wj  The law and the prophets \+add were\+add* until John:
since that time the kingdom of God is preached, and every man presseth
into it.\wj*

\wj  And it is easier for heaven and earth to pass, than one
tittle of the law to fail.\wj*

\wj  Whosoever putteth away his wife, and marrieth another,
committeth adultery: and whosoever marrieth her that is put away
from \+add her\+add* husband committeth adultery.\wj*

\wj ¶ There was a certain rich man, which was clothed in purple
and fine linen, and fared sumptuously every day:\wj*

\wj  And there was a certain beggar named Lazarus, which was
laid at his gate, full of sores,\wj*

\wj  And desiring to be fed with the crumbs which fell from
the rich man’s table: moreover the dogs came and licked his sores.\wj*

\wj  And it came to pass, that the beggar died, and was carried
by the angels into Abraham’s bosom: the rich man also died, and was
buried;\wj*

\wj  And in hell he lift up his eyes, being in torments, and
seeth Abraham afar off, and Lazarus in his bosom.\wj*

\wj  And he cried and said, Father Abraham, have mercy on
me, and send Lazarus, that he may dip the tip of his finger in water,
and cool my tongue; for I am tormented in this flame.\wj*

\wj  But Abraham said, Son, remember that thou in thy lifetime
receivedst thy good things, and likewise Lazarus evil things: but
now he is comforted, and thou art tormented.\wj*

\wj  Then he said, I pray thee therefore, father, that thou wouldest
send him to my father’s house:\wj*

\wj  For I have five brethren; that he may testify unto them,
lest they also come into this place of torment.\wj*

\wj  Abraham saith unto him, They have Moses and the prophets;
let them hear them.\wj*

\wj  And he said, Nay, father Abraham: but if one went unto
them from the dead, they will repent.\wj*

\wj  And he said unto him, If they hear not Moses and the
prophets, neither will they be persuaded, though one rose from the
dead.\wj*

Then said he unto the disciples, \wj  It is impossible but
that offences will come: but woe \+add unto him\+add*, through whom
they come!\wj*

\wj  It were better for him that a millstone were hanged about
his neck, and he cast into the sea, than that he should offend one

\wj ¶ Take heed to yourselves: If thy brother trespass against
thee, rebuke him; and if he repent, forgive him.\wj*

\wj  And if he trespass against thee seven times in a day,
and seven times in a day turn again to thee, saying, I repent; thou shalt
forgive him.\wj*
And the apostles said unto the Lord, Increase our faith.

And the Lord said, \wj  If ye had faith as a grain of mustard
seed, ye might say unto this sycamine tree, Be thou plucked up by the
root, and be thou planted in the sea; and it should obey you.\wj*

\wj  But which of you, having a servant plowing or feeding
cattle, will say unto him by and by, when he is come from the field,
Go and sit down to meat?\wj*

\wj  And will not rather say unto him, Make ready wherewith
I may sup, and gird thyself, and serve me, till I have eaten and
drunken; and afterward thou shalt eat and drink?\wj*

\wj  Doth he thank that servant because he did the things that
were commanded him? I trow not.\wj*

\wj  So likewise ye, when ye shall have done all those things
which are commanded you, say, We are unprofitable servants: we have
done that which was our duty to do.\wj*

¶ And it came to pass, as he went to Jerusalem, that he passed
through the midst of Samaria and Galilee.

And as he entered into a certain village, there met him ten
men that were lepers, which stood afar off:

And they lifted up \add their\add* voices, and said, Jesus,
Master, have mercy on us.

And when he saw \add them\add*, he said unto them, \wj  Go
shew yourselves unto the priests.\wj* And it came to pass, that,

And one of them, when he saw that he was healed, turned back,

And fell down on \add his\add* face at his feet, giving him
thanks: and he was a Samaritan.

And Jesus answering said, \wj  Were there not ten cleansed?
but where \+add are\+add* the nine?\wj*

\wj  There are not found that returned to give glory to God,
save this stranger.\wj*

And he said unto him, \wj  Arise, go thy way: thy faith hath

¶ And when he was demanded of the Pharisees, when the kingdom

\wj  Neither shall they say, Lo here! or, lo there! for, behold,

And he said unto the disciples, \wj  The days will come, when

\wj  And they shall say to you, See here; or, see there: go

\wj  For as the lightning, that lighteneth out of the one
\+add part\+add* under heaven, shineth unto the other \+add part\+add*

\wj  But first must he suffer many things, and be rejected

\wj  And as it was in the days of Noe, so shall it be also

\wj  They did eat, they drank, they married wives, they were given in

\wj  But the same day that Lot went out of Sodom it rained

\wj  Even thus shall it be in the day when the Son of man

\wj  In that day, he which shall be upon the housetop, and

\wj  Whosoever shall seek to save his life shall lose it;

\wj  I tell you, in that night there shall be two \+add men\+add*
in one bed; the one shall be taken, and the other shall be left.\wj*

\wj  Two \+add women\+add* shall be grinding together; the
one shall be taken, and the other left.\wj*

\wj Two \+add men\+add* shall be in the field; the one shall be taken, and the other
left.\wj*

And they answered and said unto him, Where, Lord? And he said
unto them, \wj  Wheresoever the body \+add is\+add*, thither will
the eagles be gathered together.\wj*

And he spake a parable unto them \add to this end\add*, that men
ought always to pray, and not to faint;

Saying, \wj  There was in a city a judge, which feared not
God, neither regarded man:\wj*

\wj  And there was a widow in that city; and she came unto

\wj  And he would not for a while: but afterward he said within

\wj  Yet because this widow troubleth me, I will avenge her,

And the Lord said, \wj  Hear what the unjust judge saith.\wj*

\wj  And shall not God avenge his own elect, which cry day

\wj  I tell you that he will avenge them speedily. Nevertheless

And he spake this parable unto certain which trusted in themselves
that they were righteous, and despised others:

\wj  Two men went up into the temple to pray; the one a Pharisee,
and the other a publican.\wj*

\wj  The Pharisee stood and prayed thus with himself, God,
I thank thee, that I am not as other men \+add are\+add*, extortioners,

\wj  I fast twice in the week, I give tithes of all that I

\wj  And the publican, standing afar off, would not lift up

\wj  I tell you, this man went down to his house justified
\+add rather\+add* than the other: for every one that exalteth himself

And they brought unto him also infants, that he would touch

But Jesus called them \add unto him\add*, and said, \wj  Suffer

\wj  Verily I say unto you, Whosoever shall not receive the

And a certain ruler asked him, saying, Good Master, what shall I

And Jesus said unto him, \wj  Why callest thou me good? none
\+add is\+add* good, save one, \+add that is\+add*, God.\wj*

\wj  Thou knowest the commandments, Do not commit adultery,

And he said, All these have I kept from my youth up.

Now when Jesus heard these things, he said unto him, \wj 
Yet lackest thou one thing: sell all that thou hast, and distribute

And when he heard this, he was very sorrowful: for he was

And when Jesus saw that he was very sorrowful, he said, \wj 
How hardly shall they that have riches enter into the kingdom of

\wj  For it is easier for a camel to go through a needle’s
eye, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.\wj*
And they that heard \add it\add* said, Who then can be saved?

\wj  And he said unto him, Well, thou good servant: because

\wj  And the second came, saying, Lord, thy pound hath gained

\wj  And he said likewise to him, Be thou also over five cities.\wj*

\wj  And another came, saying, Lord, behold, \+add here is\+add*

\wj  And he saith unto him, Out of thine own mouth will I

\wj  Wherefore then gavest not thou my money into the bank,

\wj  And he said unto them that stood by, Take from him the

\wj  But those mine enemies, which would not that I should

¶ And when he had thus spoken, he went before, ascending up

\wj  The baptism of John, was it from heaven, or of men?\wj*

From heaven; he will say, Why then believed ye him not?

\wj  And at the season he sent a servant to the husbandmen,

\wj  And again he sent another servant: and they beat him

\wj  But when the husbandmen saw him, they reasoned among

¶ And the chief priests and the scribes the same hour sought

¶ Then came to \add him\add* certain of the Sadducees, which

\wj  And David himself saith in the book of Psalms, The \+nd LORD\+nd*

\wj  Till I make thine enemies thy footstool.\wj*

\wj  David therefore calleth him Lord, how is he then his

\wj  For all these have of their abundance cast in unto the

¶ And as some spake of the temple, how it was adorned with goodly

\wj  \+add As for\+add* these things which ye behold, the days

And in the day time he was teaching in the temple; and at

¶ And the Lord said, \wj  Simon, Simon, behold, Satan hath

¶ Then took they him, and led \add him\add*, and brought him

Art thou the Christ? tell us. And he said unto them, \wj

¶ And Pilate, when he had called together the chief priests

Said unto them, Ye have brought this man unto me, as one that

No, nor yet Herod: for I sent you to him; and, lo, nothing

(For of necessity he must release one unto them at the feast.)

And they cried out all at once, saying, Away with this \add man\add*,
and release unto us Barabbas:

(Who for a certain sedition made in the city, and for murder,
was cast into prison.)

Pilate therefore, willing to release Jesus, spake again to
them.
But they cried, saying, Crucify \add him\add*, crucify him.

And he said unto them the third time, Why, what evil hath
he done? I have found no cause of death in him: I will therefore
chastise him, and let \add him\add* go.

And they were instant with loud voices, requiring that he
might be crucified. And the voices of them and of the chief priests
prevailed.
And Pilate gave sentence that it should be as they required.

And he released unto them him that for sedition and murder
was cast into prison, whom they had desired; but he delivered Jesus
to their will.

And as they led him away, they laid hold upon one Simon, a
Cyrenian, coming out of the country, and on him they laid the cross,
that he might bear \add it\add* after Jesus.

¶ And there followed him a great company of people, and of
women, which also bewailed and lamented him.

But Jesus turning unto them said, \wj  Daughters of Jerusalem,
weep not for me, but weep for yourselves, and for your children.\wj*

\wj  For, behold, the days are coming, in the which they shall
say, Blessed \+add are\+add* the barren, and the wombs that never
bare, and the paps which never gave suck.\wj*

\wj  Then shall they begin to say to the mountains, Fall on
us; and to the hills, Cover us.\wj*

\wj  For if they do these things in a green tree, what shall be
done in the dry?\wj*

And there were also two other, malefactors, led with him to be put to
death.

And when they were come to the place, which is called Calvary,
there they crucified him, and the malefactors, one on the right hand,
and the other on the left.

¶ Then said Jesus, \wj  Father, forgive them; for they know
not what they do.\wj* And they parted his raiment, and cast lots.

And the people stood beholding. And the rulers also with them
derided \add him\add*, saying, He saved others; let him save himself,
if he be Christ, the chosen of God.

And the soldiers also mocked him, coming to him, and offering
him vinegar,
And saying, If thou be the king of the Jews, save thyself.

And a superscription also was written over him in letters
of Greek, and Latin, and Hebrew, THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.

¶ And one of the malefactors which were hanged railed on him,
saying, If thou be Christ, save thyself and us.

But the other answering rebuked him, saying, Dost not thou
fear God, seeing thou art in the same condemnation?

And we indeed justly; for we receive the due reward of our
deeds: but this man hath done nothing amiss.

And he said unto Jesus, Lord, remember me when thou comest
into thy kingdom.

And Jesus said unto him, \wj  Verily I say unto thee, To day
shalt thou be with me in paradise.\wj*

And it was about the sixth hour, and there was a darkness
over all the earth until the ninth hour.

And the sun was darkened, and the veil of the temple was rent
in the midst.

¶ And when Jesus had cried with a loud voice, he said, \wj 
Father, into thy hands I commend my spirit:\wj* and having said thus,
he gave up the ghost.

Now when the centurion saw what was done, he glorified God,
saying, Certainly this was a righteous man.

And all the people that came together to that sight, beholding
the things which were done, smote their breasts, and returned.

And all his acquaintance, and the women that followed him
from Galilee, stood afar off, beholding these things.

¶ And, behold, \add there was\add* a man named Joseph, a counsellor;
\add and he was\add* a good man, and a just:

(The same had not consented to the counsel and deed of them;)
\add he was\add* of Arimathæa, a city of the Jews: who also himself
waited for the kingdom of God.

And he took it down, and wrapped it in linen, and laid it
in a sepulchre that was hewn in stone, wherein never man before was
laid.
And that day was the preparation, and the sabbath drew on.

And the women also, which came with him from Galilee, followed
after, and beheld the sepulchre, and how his body was laid.

And they returned, and prepared spices and ointments; and
rested the sabbath day according to the commandment.

Now upon the first \add day\add* of the week, very early in the
morning, they came unto the sepulchre, bringing the spices which
they had prepared, and certain \add others\add* with them.
And they found the stone rolled away from the sepulchre.
And they entered in, and found not the body of the Lord Jesus.

And it came to pass, as they were much perplexed thereabout,
behold, two men stood by them in shining garments:

And as they were afraid, and bowed down \add their\add* faces
to the earth, they said unto them, Why seek ye the living among the
dead?

He is not here, but is risen: remember how he spake unto you
when he was yet in Galilee,

Saying, The Son of man must be delivered into the hands of
sinful men, and be crucified, and the third day rise again.
And they remembered his words,

And returned from the sepulchre, and told all these things
unto the eleven, and to all the rest.

It was Mary Magdalene, and Joanna, and Mary \add the mother\add*
of James, and other \add women that were\add* with them, which told
these things unto the apostles.

And their words seemed to them as idle tales, and they believed
them not.

Then arose Peter, and ran unto the sepulchre; and stooping
down, he beheld the linen clothes laid by themselves, and departed,
wondering in himself at that which was come to pass.

¶ And, behold, two of them went that same day to a village
called Emmaus, which was from Jerusalem \add about\add* threescore
furlongs.
And they talked together of all these things which had happened.

And it came to pass, that, while they communed \add together\add*
and reasoned, Jesus himself drew near, and went with them.
But their eyes were holden that they should not know him.

And he said unto them, \wj  What manner of communications
\+add are\+add* these that ye have one to another, as ye walk, and
are sad?\wj*

And the one of them, whose name was Cleopas, answering said
unto him, Art thou only a stranger in Jerusalem, and hast not known
the things which are come to pass there in these days?

And he said unto them, \wj  What things?\wj* And they said
unto him, Concerning Jesus of Nazareth, which was a prophet mighty
in deed and word before God and all the people:

And how the chief priests and our rulers delivered him to
be condemned to death, and have crucified him.

But we trusted that it had been he which should have redeemed
Israel: and beside all this, to day is the third day since these
things were done.

Yea, and certain women also of our company made us astonished,
which were early at the sepulchre;

And when they found not his body, they came, saying, that
they had also seen a vision of angels, which said that he was alive.

And certain of them which were with us went to the sepulchre,
and found \add it\add* even so as the women had said: but him they
saw not.

Then he said unto them, \wj  O fools, and slow of heart to
believe all that the prophets have spoken:\wj*

\wj  Ought not Christ to have suffered these things, and to
enter into his glory?\wj*

And beginning at Moses and all the prophets, he expounded
unto them in all the scriptures the things concerning himself.

And they drew nigh unto the village, whither they went: and
he made as though he would have gone further.

But they constrained him, saying, Abide with us: for it is
toward evening, and the day is far spent. And he went in to tarry
with them.

And it came to pass, as he sat at meat with them, he took
bread, and blessed \add it\add*, and brake, and gave to them.

And their eyes were opened, and they knew him; and he vanished
out of their sight.

And they said one to another, Did not our heart burn within
us, while he talked with us by the way, and while he opened to us
the scriptures?

And they rose up the same hour, and returned to Jerusalem,
and found the eleven gathered together, and them that were with them,
Saying, The Lord is risen indeed, and hath appeared to Simon.

And they told what things \add were done\add* in the way,
and how he was known of them in breaking of bread.

¶ And as they thus spake, Jesus himself stood in the midst
of them, and saith unto them, \wj  Peace \+add be\+add* unto you.\wj*

But they were terrified and affrighted, and supposed that
they had seen a spirit.

And he said unto them, \wj  Why are ye troubled? and why do
thoughts arise in your hearts?\wj*

\wj  Behold my hands and my feet, that it is I myself: handle
me, and see; for a spirit hath not flesh and bones, as ye see me
have.\wj*

And when he had thus spoken, he shewed them \add his\add*
hands and \add his\add* feet.

And while they yet believed not for joy, and wondered, he
said unto them, \wj  Have ye here any meat?\wj*
And they gave him a piece of a broiled fish, and of an honeycomb.

And he said unto them, \wj  These \+add are\+add* the words
which I spake unto you, while I was yet with you, that all things
must be fulfilled, which were written in the law of Moses, and \+add in\+add*
the prophets, and \+add in\+add* the psalms, concerning me.\wj*

Then opened he their understanding, that they might understand
the scriptures,

And said unto them, \wj  Thus it is written, and thus it behoved
Christ to suffer, and to rise from the dead the third day:\wj*

\wj  And that repentance and remission of sins should be preached
in his name among all nations, beginning at Jerusalem.\wj*
\wj  And ye are witnesses of these things.\wj*

\wj ¶ And, behold, I send the promise of my Father upon you:
but tarry ye in the city of Jerusalem, until ye be endued with power
from on high.\wj*

¶ And he led them out as far as to Bethany, and he lifted up
his hands, and blessed them.

And it came to pass, while he blessed them, he was parted
from them, and carried up into heaven.

And they worshipped him, and returned to Jerusalem with great
joy:

And were continually in the temple, praising and blessing
God. Amen.
